content.question: The center is in the first quadrant and is labeled E. The negative-sloped asymptote passes through points A, E, and C. The positive-sloped asymptote passes through points D, E, and B. Both asymptotes are graphed as dashed lines and intersect at point E. A horizontal segment A B is graphed from the negative-sloped asymptote at point A through the upper vertex of the hyperbola, to the positive-sloped asymptote at point B. A similar horizontal segment D C is graphed from the positive-sloped asymptote at point D through the lower vertex of the hyperbola, to the negative-sloped asymptote at point C. A vertical segment is graphed from point A down to point D, and a vertical segment is graphed from point B down to point C. All five plotted points are in the first quadrant.
